items.text: goes for an audacious reverse sweep, played too early, allowing Shakib to alter his length, beaten.
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Phehlukwayo, no run

items.text: lobbed but just short of Mashrafe at extra cover
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Phehlukwayo, 1 run

items.text: sliding down leg, JP uses the depth of the crease to help it on its way past short fine leg. Welcome boundary
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy, FOUR runs

items.text: rocks back to cut but this one keeps a touch low, beaten
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy, no run

items.text: gentle bunt into the off side for a quick single
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy, 1 run

items.preText:
Jakir Ahmed: "We have had some bitter experiences in the past. So, no party until the last ball is bowled or the last wicket uprooted." -- Understood. Bangalore 2016. Hmmm

Saifuddin is back into the attack
items.text: thick edge, squirted past short third man. Excellent start to the over, the game is still alive. Went for the yorker, right idea. Not much wrong with the delivery
items.postText: Trihan: "Too soon to start any celebration at all, Shashank! "
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Duminy, FOUR runs

items.text: cutter, length on the shorter side, pulled to deep square leg
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Duminy, 1 run

items.text: slower length ball angling away, Andile waits and waits, initially looking to slash over point, before he leaves. Wide called
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Phehlukwayo, 1 wide

items.text: full and straight outside leg, drilled to long-on
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Phehlukwayo, 1 run

items.preText: Sadman Hasan: "Watching the game with my parents from ball one. With the festive of Eid-ul-Fitr right around the corner, a Bangladesh win here would certainly serve us up an early treat."
items.text: punches this to deep cover
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Duminy, 1 run

items.text: full toss and he's sliced this straight to the man at the edge of the ring at cover. Looked to back away and whack this over the infield, didn't get enough bat on it. Good, low catch by Shakib. South Africa right on the edge.
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Phehlukwayo, OUT

dismissal.text: AL Phehlukwayo c Shakib Al Hasan b Mohammad Saifuddin 8 (18m 13b 1x4 0x6) SR: 61.53

items.text: full and straight on the stumps, squeezed back to the bowler
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Morris, no run

items.preText: Abu Sufian: "South Africa bitterly missing ABD Villiers."
items.text: steps out to go over long-on, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy, 1 run

items.preText: Nitish R: "A victory is not out of sight for SA. They shouldn't be disheartened even if they lose this game. History has taught us something--in the 1992 WC, Pakistan lost three matches in the group stage and one other match was abandoned after England bowled them out for 74. Pakistan went on to win the WC. Steyn's return should boost their confidence ahead of their clash against India."
items.text: cut away to deep point
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Morris, 1 run

items.text: sharp turn back into middle and leg, works this to midwicket
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy, 1 run

items.text: eased into the gap at sweeper cover, they'll come back for the second quite comfortably
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Morris, 2 runs

items.text: whips this down to long-on, looking for the big hit but didn't get the connection he would've liked
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Morris, 1 run

items.text: mistimes this hoick to long-on
items.postText: ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster pegs South Africa's win probability to less than 10%
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Duminy, 1 run

items.text: slower ball gone wrong, bowls this too far wide outside off
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Duminy, 1 wide

items.preText: An upset Jason belts out: "Will people stop taking about AB? He left so long ago - there's bigger problems all stemming from a poor domestic setup and bringing players that had only just recovered from injury / carrying one. Poor selection and dare I say we are watching the death of South African cricket right now...:
items.text: slower bouncer, Morris waits and decides it's worth leaving it for height. No-ball called, free-hit time It also happened to be a frontfoot no-ball
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Duminy, 1 run

items.text: backs away and squeezes this full yorker to deep cover
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Morris, 1 no ball
Mohammad Saifuddin to Morris, 1 run

items.text: makes room and eases this to deep cover
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Duminy, 2 runs

items.text: superb yorker, right into the base of leg stump, squeezed into the leg side
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Duminy, 1 run

items.text: can't put away this full toss, toe-ends it wide of cover
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Morris, 1 run
